prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC4388
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This target SM about 10^10 Modot/kpc^2 and SFR about 10^-0.3 Modot/yr/kpc^2. The radio power (vL8GHz) is about 10^37.8 erg/s. This target has significant inner stellar structures.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The molecular mass is estimated by gas-SFR relation, aka KS law (Kennicutt 1998, Schmidt 1959). We also check this ratio in circumnuclear region in NGC1068 (Tsai et al. 2012). The CO line intensity is eatimated follow X factor XCO = 3e20 cm^{-2} (K km s^{-1})^{-1}. The line width is estimated follow previous CO observation, which have velocity dispersion about 150 km/s around nuclei and 30km/s within the inner structures. The noise level is determined to get SN higher than 10.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC4374
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This target SM about 10^9.7 Modot/kpc^2 and SFR about 10^-1.7 Modot/yr/kpc^2. This target has no inner stellar structures.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The molecular mass is estimated by gas-SFR relation, aka KS law (Kennicutt 1998, Schmidt 1959). We also check this ratio in circumnuclear region in NGC1068 (Tsai et al. 2012). The CO line intensity is eatimated follow X factor XCO = 3e20 cm^{-2} (K km s^{-1})^{-1}. prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC4388
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This target SM about 10^10 Modot/kpc^2 and SFR about 10^-0.3 Modot/yr/kpc^2. The radio power (vL8GHz) is about 10^37.8 erg/s. This target has significant inner stellar structures.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The molecular mass is estimated by gas-SFR relation, aka KS law (Kennicutt 1998, Schmidt 1959). We also check this ratio in circumnuclear region in NGC1068 (Tsai et al. 2012). The CO line intensity is eatimated follow X factor XCO = 3e20 cm^{-2} (K km s^{-1})^{-1}. The CO(2-1) line intensity is determined by the line ratio CO(2-1)/CO(1-0)=1. Previous studies show that the R21 can be 0.6 to 1.5 in CMGs. The line width is estimated follow previous CO observation, which have velocity dispersion about 150 km/s around nuclei and 30km/s within the inner structures. The noise level is determined to get SN higher than 10.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We aim to get a systematic imaging survey of the CO(1-0) and CO(2-1) emission from the central region of the host galaxies of nearby AGNs. Our previous studies shows that active galaxies have higher stellar masses (SMs) and star formation rates (SFRs) than normal galaxies do, but both active and normal galaxies exhibit similar specific star formation rates (SSFRs). In particular, we found that certain nearby AGNs exhibit substantial inner stellar structures within the central 1-kpc regions in the NIR images; the AGNs with the inner structures show a positive correlation between the radio activity of the AGNs and the SFRs of the host galaxies, but the sources without inner structures show a negative correlation between the radio power of AGNs and the SFRs. However, it is unclear whether the more active AGN with higher SFRs really have a higher star formation efficiency or not because without information about molecular gas in these AGNs. This proposal aims to observe the molecular gas in the central regions of nearby AGNs. The results will conclude the AGN influence on the star formation activities in the inner region of the host galaxies and explain the observed AGN-SF connection.

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: Institute of Astronomy, National Central University

prp:CoInvestigator.prp:organisation: Institute of Astronomy, National Central University
